news.title: Can MotorLand give us a magic number eight?
news.subTitle: After seven winners, we arrive at Aragon with an empty throne. A new winner at the track is guaranteed, but can it be the eighth this year?
news.desc: After a dramatic, at times chaotic but always entertaining French GP, it‚Äôs time for the paddock to saddle up and head for the very different MotorLand Aragon. An outpost of speed in rural Teruel, the backdrop is a very different one to that of Le Mans ‚Äì and so is the track. With Marc Marquez (Repsol Honda Team), Dani Pedrosa, Jorge Lorenzo and Casey Stoner the only riders to have won at the venue, we‚Äôll have a new rider on the top step. But will it be a new winner in 2020? Or a first timer? We‚Äôre about to find out‚Ä¶

news.title: Vietti and Arbolino aim to gain more ground in Aragon
news.subTitle: The Moto3‚Ñ¢ title fight now sees four riders in 20 points... and another 25 in play at MotorLand
news.desc: Another race, another Moto3‚Ñ¢ rollercoaster and another throw of the dice in Le Mans sees the Moto3‚Ñ¢ Championship heading into the Gran Premio Michelin¬Æ de Aragon looking a little spicier than it did just a week ago. For one, home hero Albert Arenas (Solunion Aspar Team Moto3) is back on top after a podium saw him hit back against Ai Ogura (Honda Team Asia), and for two... the three men behind them all had another shuffle.

news.title: Canet undergoes successful finger surgery
news.subTitle: The Inde Aspar Team Moto2 rider suffered an open fracture-dislocation on his fifth left hand finger in Le Mans Warm Up
news.desc: Inde Aspar Team Moto2‚Äôs Aron Canet has undergone successful surgery on an open fracture-dislocation of the two interphalangeal joints of the fifth finger of the left hand, sustained in a Warm Up crash at the SHARK Helmets Grand Prix de France.

news.title: Can Lowes keep the momentum at MotorLand?
news.subTitle: The Brit just won for the first time since 2016, when he last did it at‚Ä¶ you guessed it! Aragon. And now he‚Äôs only an apt 22 points off...
news.desc: Since the season re-started in Jerez, it‚Äôs been a bit of an Italian invasion in the Moto2‚Ñ¢ class. And, despite a tougher race last time out, it remains Luca Marini (Sky Racing Team VR46) on top in the standings ‚Äì with Enea Bastianini (Italtrans Racing Team) now just 15 points down and Marco Bezzecchi (Sky Racing Team VR46) only a further five. But the man with the momentum and the winner last time out, Sam Lowes (EG 0,0 Marc VDS), now arrives at a venue that‚Äôs treated him well ‚Äì and he‚Äôs looking to continue his roll.

news.title: Michelin to take top billing at the Gran Premio de Aragon
news.subTitle: Official tyre supplier to both MotoGP‚Ñ¢ and MotoE‚Ñ¢ set to title sponsor the first MotoGP‚Ñ¢ event at MotorLand Aragon in 2020
news.desc: Dorna Sports is delighted to announce MotoGP‚Ñ¢ and FIM Enel MotoE‚Ñ¢ World Cup tyre supplier Michelin as title sponsor for the Gran Premio de Aragon in 2020, giving the French marque top billing at the event for the second year running. The Grand Prix, which takes place from the 16th to the 18th of October, will therefore be named the Gran Premio Michelin¬Æ de Aragon. Michelin have been the official tyre supplier to the premier class of Grand Prix motorcycle racing since 2016, a collaboration that has created some of the closest racing ever seen in MotoGP‚Ñ¢ ‚Äì with records smashed and margins narrowed in an era of amazing competition. More history has been in the making since 2019 as the legendary tyre marque became the official tyre supplier to the FIM Enel MotoE‚Ñ¢ World Cup, once again proving a partner synonymous with both incredible performance and impressive reliability. Michelin are also a vital part of the MotoGP‚Ñ¢ eSport Championship, having been a founding partner of the series since  its inception in 2017. This new title sponsor agreement serves to add another vital facet to a relationship between MotoGP‚Ñ¢ and Michelin that has been defined by shared success. Matthew Ye, Senior Vice President Business Line 2 Wheels Worldwide: Michelin has been a partner for the MotoGP World Championship since 2016, with racing at the heart of Michelin Group DNA since our company foundation.  Continuing our involvement with the ‚ÄòGran Premio Michelin de Arag√≥n‚Äô for 2020  as title sponsor is a strong testimonial of our passion for competition.The purpose of our commitments in motorsport is to take its technologies forward and provide all riders with the very best products.  This year we see a comprehensive new number of Michelin hypersport tyre ranges benefiting from the winning technologies.  Biking enthusiasts now have more opportunity with our new products MICHELIN Power 5 & MICHELIN Power GP, inspired by Motorsport.Pau Serracanta, Managing Director at Dorna Sports Michelin have been a vital partner for the MotoGP World Championship since 2016, as well as MotoE and MotoGP eSport thereafter, and are a foundation of the incredible boom the sport is enjoying. It makes us very happy to be able to add another agreement to our partnership and to see Michelin lend their name to what is sure to be another spectacular event at the uniquely beautiful MotorLand Aragon.

news.title: Beaubier clinches fifth MotoAmerica Superbike title
news.subTitle: Bobby Fong and Lorenzo Zanetti took victories in Indianapolis as the Yamaha man was crowned king at the Brickyard
news.desc: Three things of note jump out after a three-HONOS Superbike race weekend at Indianapolis Motor Speedway: for starters, Italian Lorenzo Zanetti ended a winless drought for Ducati in AMA Superbike racing that dated back to 2010. Then there was Bobby Fong‚Äôs arrival as a bonafide MotoAmerica Superbike star with a weekend that saw him win two races and finish second in the only one he didn‚Äôt win. And it all wrapped up with the bow on top being the fact that Cameron Beaubier emerged from a somewhat difficult weekend with a fifth MotoAmerica Superbike Championship in his back pocket. For the first time all season, Monster Energy Attack Performance Yamaha‚Äôs Beaubier wasn‚Äôt the dominant force at Indy. With the weight of trying to put the championship on ice in the penultimate round, Beaubier had some struggles. He crashed out of Saturday‚Äôs race one and it put a visible dent in his confidence for Sunday‚Äôs two races. Even with the pressure, he persevered and finished on the podium in both races ‚Äì third in race two and second in race three. With that, he takes an insurmountable 97-point lead to WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca in two weeks where he hopes to return to his winning ways in an attempt to match Josh Hayes‚Äô 16-win season from 2012.

news.title: Vi√±ales fastest in delayed Aragon MotoGP‚Ñ¢ FP1
news.subTitle: Cold conditions saw the opening premier class session delayed by half an hour, Championship leader Quartararo crashes on Friday morning
news.desc: Maverick Vi√±ales (Monster Energy Yamaha MotoGP) topped a very cool Gran Premio Michelin¬Æ de Aragon FP1, the Spaniard setting a 1:49.866 to lead a Yamaha trio at the top. Petronas Yamaha SRT teammates Franco Morbidelli and Fabio Quartararo completed the top three, both crashed on Friday morning though.

news.title: Yamaha: no Rossi replacement planned for Aragon
news.subTitle: Monster Energy Yamaha MotoGP Team Manager Massimo Meregalli expects the Italian to return in Valencia, no stand-in currently on the cards
news.desc: Speaking to both motogp.com pitlane reporter Simon Crafar and Sky Sport Italia MotoGP during MotoGP‚Ñ¢ FP1 at the Gran Premio Michelin¬Æ de Aragon, Monster Energy Yamaha MotoGP Team Manager Massimo Meregalli has admitted that there are currently no plans to replace Valentino Rossi for the MotorLand Aragon double headers.

news.title: Binder bags top spot in chilly Moto3‚Ñ¢ FP1 in Aragon
news.subTitle: Ambient air temperature of eight degrees at the start of the session meant it was a cold start to the Michelin Aragon Grand Prix
news.desc: Ambient air temperature of eight degrees at the start of the session meant it was a cold start to the Michelin Aragon Grand Prix

news.title: Arenas to make Moto2‚Ñ¢ step with Aspar in 2021
news.subTitle: The current Moto3‚Ñ¢ Championship leader will compete in his sixth season with the team, moving up the ranks after a strong 2020
news.desc: Albert Arenas will make the leap up to Moto2‚Ñ¢ with the Aspar Team in 2021. The current Moto3‚Ñ¢ World Championship leader will compete in his sixth season with the team next year and will do so by moving up to the intermediate category, after having fought for the Moto3‚Ñ¢ title in a season in which he has accumulated three victories and a total of five podiums to date. Next year he will be Aron Canet‚Äôs teammate and will ride a Speed Up.

news.title: MP1 brings Indonesia into MotoGP‚Ñ¢ with Gresini Racing
news.subTitle: A new multi-year deal begins in 2021, including a new racing academy aimed at promoting and supporting young Indonesian riders
news.desc: MP1, an Indonesian company operating in the ever-growing events and sports management industry, will be the new partner of the #GresiniFamily. Starting in 2021, through a multiple-year agreement that sees MP1 become a partner of the team across all categories: MotoGP‚Ñ¢, Moto2‚Ñ¢, Moto3‚Ñ¢ and MotoE‚Ñ¢.
